urls.title: Precious chalk stream in Bexley gets health boost - Thames21
urls.description: Bexley residents and local wildlife can now enjoy a healthier river Cray where it flows through Foots Cray Meadows, Bexley.Waterways charity Thames21 has carried out restoration work on an 800m stretch of the river

tweets.text: This month we complete our restoration works on the river Cray, #Bexley, in partnership with @LBofBexley @EnovertCT & @EnvAgency. We can't wait to see the positive impacts of rewilding this river, like more plants, birds & fish thriving 🐟 Read more: https://t.co/x04GRodbUL https://t.co/qdz6Tw2h9J

tweets.text:
We have teamed up with @EnvAgency for an online event and would like to know young people’s opinions on future water management, youth engagement and future governance.

🗓️Tuesday 16 March
📣Inspiring guest speakers 
🗨️Take part in a Q&A

Sign up here👇
https://t.co/Gmx3uHGWJI https://t.co/ytACS1HL8H

@KoalaChlo Just pushes the problem further downstream to the next unfortunate village or town. And surely any new scheme should be designed to remove the risk, not simply reduce it, unless the EA are aware that the proposal is doomed to fail from the outset?

Deeply worrying evidence emerged from this talk about potential impact of #HS2 tunnelling on the aquifer and the Misbourne. tweets.text: How many of you think that #Vedic #Mantras can #Modulate #Microbial load oof your #Living_room? Know at https://t.co/UpxL6NKiiL

Yes @EnvAgency - please explain how you are managing to both permit a huge waste #incinerator and promote a quarry (pretending to be a flood relief scheme) - within a few miles of each other. https://t.co/gySHByh5nV

Anyone managing waste outside the law is committing #WasteCrime.

We successfully seized this truck, believed to be involved in waste crime, in a joint operation with the police.

Help us continue our fight by completing the Waste Crime Survey 👇

https://t.co/S6bV2wnn2w https://t.co/qpp8Kf2bcV
@sony991 Thanks Nick. These should be cleared by @EnvAgencySE while the river has been lower this week.

Proud to hear @BorisJohnson praise @EnvAgency staff today at #PMQs for their tireless work protecting communities from flooding. 

New defences built over the last decade mean we’ve seen significantly fewer homes flooded during that period. https://t.co/v4a7qT1KZG

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency We're having similar issues with the @EnvAgency.  Thousands of complaints and they do nothing. Sorry they installed monitoring equipment and forgot to turn it on.

Smell of sewage and cloudy water with brown debris in the canal downstream of Berkhamsted sewage treatment works, Bullbeggars Lane, and flowing into Bulbourne - apparently it has been like this for days. @EnvAgency @thameswater is sewage being released? #chalkstreams https://t.co/6LTNy1Am4r

@ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2  Ponds full of rancid, contaminated, stinking water at the quarry but don't worry, this is just a minor breach. Are you for real? #stopthestink #capitoff https://t.co/YJuW0HQJ1M

@Newcast42068272 @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe They are controversial, You wanted them! we’ve got them! Right Said ‘Red’!! They’ve been added  to the line up smelliest line up in the UK!! They don’t need masks 😷 for the  stink, they are the stink! Bring your own oxygen #stopthestink #stinkfest https://t.co/hpJpxwOmlx

@Newcast42068272 @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe Late announcement today #stinkfest ... it’s not Simply Red...it’s Mainly ‘Red’... they say no to holding back the stink (for years...) bring your own peg or oxygen #stopthestink https://t.co/Tt9Y8WwjN6
@EnvAgency With more than 80% of complaints made you you nationally, being about the landfill site at Walley's Quarry. How are you allowing this to continue? https://t.co/lQerICMmop

Genuinely interesting & important 10 Minute Rule Bill being introduced by @AaronBell4NUL, could have significant impact on how the @EnvAgency enforce and take action in the future. @IainDale would be an interesting topic for a phone in as there's very little other news around! https://t.co/IyBDqE1snZ

@MissMaisyDaisy @LoneRanger77777 @StinkStopthe @BBCRadioStoke @Sotlive @bbcmtd @ITVCentral @HouseofCommons @AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @RedIndustries2 The kicker was that astonishing self-pitying and aggressive letter to Aaron Bell. The problem now is that until they admit there's a problem, things will escalate. If the EA is unable or unwilling to take action, this could get unpleasant.

@StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA Staggering, what will it take for them to act? @PHE_uk are inundated with Walleys Quarry health concerns.

urls.title: Eye On Calderdale
urls.description: Your one stop website for up to date information about flooding, weather and traffic disruptions across the Borough of Calderdale.

tweets.text: An @EnvAgencyYNE flood alert is in force for the Upper River Calder catchment. This means flooding is possible so please be ready to follow your flood plan and check https://t.co/SOPqHGairw for updates and preparation advice. https://t.co/zQPzzDDagt
